parse.title: List of cities in China by life expectancy

text.*:
This article is an orphan, as no other articles link to it. Please introduce links to this page from related articles; try the Find link tool for suggestions. (December 2015)

This is a list of the cities of the People's Republic of China, including all direct-controlled municipalities, sub-provincial cities, prefecture-level cities, but excluding special administrative regions, in order of their life expectancy.

Most cities with high life expectancy are located in the Yangtze River Delta, Pearl River Delta and Beijing-Tianjin region.

This list is incomplete; you can help by expanding it.
Rank City Life expectancy Year Comparable country[1] Province
1 Shanghai 83.18[2] 2017   Switzerland Shanghai
2 Suzhou 82.87[3] 2015  Australia Jiangsu #1
3 Zhuhai 82.50[4] 2015  Israel Guangdong #1
4 Wuxi 82.21[5] 2014  Canada Jiangsu #2
5 Nanjing 82.19[6] 2015  Canada Jiangsu #3
6 Beijing 81.95[7] 2015  Netherlands Beijing
7 Tianjin 81.19[8] 2012  Austria Tianjin
8 Hangzhou 80.89[9] 2011  Greece Zhejiang #1
9 Dalian 80.76[10] 2015  Denmark Liaoning #1
10 Qingdao 80.71[11] 2012  Germany Shandong #1
11 Taiyuan 80.42[12] 2012  United Kingdom Shanxi #1
12 Ningbo 80.33[13] 2012  United Kingdom Zhejiang #2
13 Xiamen 80.02[14] 2014  Chile Fujian #1
14 Sanya 80.00[citation needed] 2013  Chile Hainan #1
15 Shenyang 79.56[15] 2011 (urban only)  Slovenia Liaoning #2
16 Wuhan 79.27[16] 2011 (urban only)  Cuba Hubei #1
17 Guangzhou 79.04[17] 2010  United States Guangdong #2
18 Changchun 78.88[18] 2009  United States Jilin #1
19 Anshan 78.74[19] 2013  United States Liaoning #3
20 Changsha 78.66[20] 2011 (urban only)  Brunei Hunan #1
21 Shenzhen 78.30[21] 2011  Qatar Guangdong #3
22 Jinan 78.20[22] 2012  Qatar Shandong #2
23 Hefei 78.12[23] 2011  Qatar Anhui #1
24 Chengdu 77.94[24] 2012  Czech Republic Sichuan #1
25 Yantai 77.86[25] 2011  Czech Republic Shandong #3
26 Chongqing 77.81[26] 2012  Czech Republic Chongqing
27 Changzhou 77.55 2011  Czech Republic Jiangsu #4
28 Kunming 77.50[27] 2014  Czech Republic Yunnan #1
29 Nanchang 77.50[28] 2013 (estimate)  Czech Republic Jiangxi #1
30 Zhenjiang 76.78 2011  United Arab Emirates Jiangsu #5
31 Xi'an 75.86[29] 2012  Saudi Arabia Shaanxi #1
32 Harbin 75.81[30] 2010  Saudi Arabia Heilongjiang #1
33 Lanzhou 75.03[31] 2012  Slovenia Gansu #1
34 Guiyang 74.86[32] 2012  Hungary Guizhou #1
